Title: The Owner of a House and a Thief
Medium: ink and pigments on thin laid paper (probably Kashmiri)
Description: This illustration from Walters manuscript W.626 depicts an exchange between the owner of a house and a thief who makes a hole in the wall to break in, while pretending that he is playing drums.
Keywords: Islamic; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; India; Sufism; Literature -- Poetry; Literature -- Prose
Provenance: Ibrahim [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [round seal impression, Ibrahim (...) on front flyleaf iia]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Jalal al-Din Rumi, Maulana (Persian, 1207-1273)
